snippet: The central bank on Tuesday raised its benchmark rate by a quarter percentage point to help contain the country’s current-account deficit for the fifth time since June.
abstract: Indonesia's central bank raises its benchmark rate by a quarter percentage point to 7.5 percent to help contain the country’s current-account deficit for fifth time since June; says move will help to keep inflation under control.
lead_paragraph: The central bank on Tuesday raised its benchmark rate by a quarter percentage point to help contain the country’s current-account deficit for the fifth time since June.

headline.main: Indonesia Central Bank Increases Rate, Again
headline.print_headline: Indonesia Central Bank Increases Rate, Again
